entry.et: Middle English, to look at, consider, advise, from Anglo-French aviser, from avis

def.dt: :to give (someone) a recommendation about what should be done :to give advice to advise her to try a drier climate
:caution warn advise them of the consequences
:to give information or notice to :inform advise them of their rights
:to give a recommendation about what should be done advise on legal matters
:to talk with someone in order to decide what should be done :consult advise with friends
